intro: Barneoudia chilensis var. patagonica, commonly known as the Patagonian barneoudia, is a flowering plant native to southern South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its foliage is usually narrow and grass-like, with small, clustered flower heads that bloom in the spring. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
